content:
As an AI language model, I do not have access to specific, up-to-date information on how urbanization has affected certain industries in rural areas in Minas Gerais. However, some industries that may be particularly affected by urbanization in rural areas generally could include agriculture, livestock, and forestry, as these industries are often the backbone of rural economies. Urbanization could lead to the conversion of farmland and forests into residential, commercial, or industrial areas, reducing land availability for rural businesses to operate. Additionally, rural businesses in these industries may face increased competition from larger firms with economies of scale, which may be more common in urban areas. 

That being said, there are also opportunities for rural businesses in these industries to adapt and innovate to meet changing market demand and take advantage of new technologies and infrastructure made available through urbanization. For example, some farmers in rural areas have shifted from traditional crops towards organic farming or niche markets, such as specialty coffee production, to differentiate themselves from larger competitors. It is important to note that the impacts of urbanization on rural businesses can vary widely based on specific local conditions and other factors.
